Review Text: Ok, I hate it when a great pilot is shown, gets great reviews and isn't picked up.  This is a GREAT  story.  I love the blend of city and country settings, I like the characters, and I want to know what happens to brothers, cousins, and grandparents.  More, more, more please !!
Review Title: I Want To Know What's Next
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Alpha House
Comedy, Drama
["An Amazon Original series: They work in the Senate. They live in the house - Alpha House. Created by Garry Trudeau (Doonesbury, Tanner '88)."]
{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch'], 'Directors': ['Adam Bernstein', 'Michael Mayer', 'Andrew McCarthy', 'Bob Balaban', 'Jann Turner', 'Jake Schreier', 'Antoine Douaihy', 'Clark Johnson', 'Michael Pressman'], 'Producers': ['Jonathan Alter']}
I do not like politics in real life.  But this clever show makes me laugh because I think it might be closer to the truth than politicians will admit.
Funny pokes at politics
Justified
Suspense, Western, Drama, Action
["Deputy US Marshal Raylan Givens (Timothy Olyphant) will start to pick at the thread of a cold case over 30 years in the making, unraveling a riddle that echoes all the way back to his boyhood and his criminal father's bad dealings. Meanwhile, Boyd Crowder (Walton Goggins) finds his grip on Harlan loosening due to a Pentecostal preacher with a penchant for theatrics and a knack for manipulation..."]
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Adam Arkin', 'Jon Avnet', 'Peter Werner', 'Michael Dinner', 'John Dahl', 'Bill Johnson', 'Michael W. Watkins', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Don Kurt', 'Dean Parisot'], 'Producers': ['Fred Golan', 'Sarah Timberman', 'Carl Beverly', 'Michael Dinner', 'Graham Yost', 'Elmore Leonard']}
I enjoy westerners.  Justified is a modern day cowboy tale.  Even some of the bad guys are loveable and others are just plain fun to hate.  Every once in awhile, I find myself boo and hissing at events.
love the modern day cowboy
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Richard Starzak', 'Christopher Sadler', 'Jay Grace', 'Lee Wilton', 'Seamus Malone', 'Jean-Philippe Vine', 'Richard Webber', 'Will Becher', 'Mike Mort', 'Dave Osmand'], 'Starring': ['John Sparkes', 'Justin Fletcher', 'Kate Harbour'], 'Studio': ['Aardman Animations']}
Love Shaun the Sheep.  He IA always thinking.  He doesn't miss a beat, I hope you will be able to meet, Shaun the Sheep.  I love Shirley and Timmy too
Dont miss a beat, come watch Shaun the Sheep

profile:
User Preferences Summary:

- **Genres**: Continues to favor comedy and drama, particularly satire and clever political humor. Recent engagement with Westerns and suspense dramas complements an expanding interest in narrative-driven genres. The user has shown an increasing appreciation for animated content, reflecting an openness to diverse storytelling formats.

- **Tone**: Enjoys narratives that blend humor with critical perspectives on serious themes, particularly politics and morality. Strong interest in character dynamics, including lovable villains and the complexities of good versus evil, remains evident across various genres, including animation.

- **Content Sensitivity**: Engages comfortably with mature themes, such as violence, substance use, and explicit language, valuing gritty storytelling that entertains while offering depth. This extends to animated and family-oriented content that resonates with mature audiences.

- **Viewing Purpose**: Seeks entertainment that is both amusing and reflective of real-world issues, with a preference for narratives that provide social commentary and evoke emotions like tension, humor, and introspection.

- **Engagement Style**: Exhibits enthusiasm for media featuring clever writing and robust character arcs, consistently rating comedies, dramas, and animated series positively. A recent high rating for a pilot reaffirms a solid investment in character-driven storytelling, particularly when narratives explore familial relationships and intertwine various settings.

Overall, the user values insightful, emotionally engaging storytelling across genres, characterized by themes that challenge and entertain.
